page.title: 07KEMPSTON FIRE STATION
page.content: The Fire Station is located in the east of Kempston beside the main Bedford to St. Pancras Railway Line. It is a modern Fire Station and was {opened on 21 May 1971}by Alderman Leslie G. Boules, Chairman of the County Council. The Fire Station has 3 fire engines, 1 water tender, 1 main control unit, 1 canteen wagon and one unit on standby.Each appliance carries 8 men. Some firemen live in the houses opposite the station. The Fire Station {covers the area}of Cranfield, Marston Mortaine, Haynes, Stagsden, Bromham, Kempston and parts of Bedford. The {firemen train}on Wednesdays, and have been known to use Daubeney Middle School's cross_country course. They also have a 100 foot tower at the fire station on which they practice. They use a 14 stone dummy to simulate a body.
